summary: Kathryn Dyer is mentioned in three memoranda summarizing the results of an ARRB (Assassination Records Review Board) meeting held on November 17, 1997. The documents detail decisions regarding the release of CIA records related to the JFK assassination. While the documents mention CIA records related to Warrenton Records Center, CIA's use of State Cover, Nosenko NBR records, Cuban Revolutionary Council financial records, the Ramparts Damage Assessment Document, Book Cables Dissemination Lists, and Document #104-10072-10232, the specific role or involvement of Kathryn Dyer is not detailed in these summaries. Therefore, it is not possible to determine her role or significance in the JFK assassination context based solely on these documents.
significance: The significance of Kathryn Dyer in the JFK context cannot be determined from the provided documents.
